meanings.definition: Apply a new coat of paint or varnish to (something).
meanings.sent1: I will recoat the fence with fresh paint.
meanings.sent2: The painter will recoat the walls next week.
meanings.sent3: The artist recoated the canvas with vibrant colors, making it come alive.
meanings.sent4: She recoated her nails with glitter polish, turning them into sparkling gems.
meanings.sent5: Recoating the old chair transformed it into a beautiful piece of furniture.

meanings.definition: The action of applying a new coat of paint or varnish to something.
meanings.sent1: The recoating of the house made it look brand new.
meanings.sent2: He specializes in the recoating of antique furniture.
meanings.sent3: The recoating of the car turned it into a colorful work of art.
meanings.sent4: The recoating of the boat protected it from the harsh sea elements.
meanings.sent5: The recoating of the building enhanced its appearance significantly.
